pullRequest.body:
Add `IntermediateField.restrict`, which restricts the containing field of an intermediate field to another intermediate field which is greater than or equal to it.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [dc416d7a05](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14640/commits/dc416d7a05e5a5b32a90446d0ade0b18f66cb33a)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ lift_le`
`+ lift_restrict`
`+ mem_lift`
`+ mem_restrict`
`+ restrict`
`+ restrict_algEquiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
Consider the name `shrink` instead. (c.f. `Mathlib.Logic.Small.Basic`)

> Consider the name `shrink` instead. (c.f. `Mathlib.Logic.Small.Basic`)

Simply `shrink`? That will have to be `protected`, right?

> Consider the name `shrink` instead. (c.f. `Mathlib.Logic.Small.Basic`)

But the `IntermediateField.restrictUniverse` is not related to universe level... IMHO its name should not contain `universe` ...

PS: ~~What is the difference of your definition and [IntermediateField.extendScalars](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/IntermediateField.html#IntermediateField.extendScalars)?~~

So your definition can be viewed as an inverse to [IntermediateField.lift](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/FieldTheory/IntermediateField.html#IntermediateField.lift). Would you like to add the results of it, parallel to that of `IntermediateField.extendScalars`?
Oops, I didn't even look. Yes, this definitely must not have `universe` in the name!
I changed it to `restrict`

I have this proof:
```lean
theorem lift_le (E : IntermediateField K F) : lift E ≤ F := by
  intro _ h
  obtain ⟨_, _, rfl⟩ := h
  simp

theorem mem_lift {E : IntermediateField K F} (x : F) : x.1 ∈ lift E ↔ x ∈ E :=
  Subtype.val_injective.mem_set_image

theorem mem_restrict (x : E) : x ∈ restrict h ↔ x.1 ∈ F := by
  rw [restrict, AlgHom.mem_fieldRange]
  refine ⟨?_, fun hx ↦ ⟨⟨x.1, hx⟩, rfl⟩⟩
  rintro ⟨y, rfl⟩
  exact y.2

@[simp]
theorem lift_restrict : lift (restrict h) = F := by
  ext x
  refine ⟨fun hx ↦ ?_, fun hx ↦ ?_⟩
  · let y : E := ⟨x, lift_le (restrict h) hx⟩
    exact (mem_restrict h y).1 ((mem_lift y).1 hx)
  let y : E := ⟨x, h hx⟩
  exact (mem_lift y).2 ((mem_restrict h y).2 hx)
```
But it's not necessary shorter than yours. In my opinion it's more clear.
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10021406777/job/27700031502)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10021406777/job/27700031676)

I think this need not to be `protected`.

Also, do you think the definition `comap E.val F` is better? This basically is `E ⊓ F` viewed as an intermediate field of `E / K`. But since `F ≤ E`, it is just `F`. Probably this definition will make the proof of `lift_restrict` simpler.
Isn't `restrict` too general of a name to not be protected?
I don't think so; even `lift` is not protected.

```suggestion
  rintro _ ⟨x, _, rfl⟩
  exact x.2
```

```suggestion
    x.1 ∈ lift E ↔ x ∈ E :=
  Subtype.val_injective.mem_set_image
```

```suggestion
theorem mem_restrict (x : E) : x ∈ restrict h ↔ x.1 ∈ F :=
  Set.ext_iff.mp (Set.range_inclusion h) x
```

```suggestion
  · let y : E := ⟨x, h hx⟩
    exact (mem_lift y).2 ((mem_restrict h y).2 hx)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory/IntermediateField): add `restrict`
